nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## 2. Decide Whether a new Event Should Be Created
[Read more about using the Code]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

For more complex workflows, sometimes you may need to gather and prepare variables before the rest of the workflow runs. The Code node is one such tool to achieve this if you're familiar with code but its not the only way.

This workflow splits based on whether the event needs to be created. When it already exists, attendees are updated for the existing event instead.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## 3. Using AI Agent to Automate Event Creation
[Read more about AI Agents]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

AI Agents are generally described as self-governing LLMs with access to various "tools" which extend their knowledge and/or capability. In this demo, we've instructed the AI to do the following:
1. Generate a nice Event title.
2. Parse and assume dates and times from user message.
3. Parse the address and website of location/venue and to use the "tools" if it cannot get this data from the message or its own knowledge.

nodes.name: Sticky Note6

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!
### This workflow does the following
* Monitors a slack channel for event messages tagged with the Calendar (ðŸ“…) emoji.
* Checks if a calender event exists otherwise uses ChatGPT to create the calendar event; AI will add event title, description and location details.
* If calendar event exists, checks for channel users who have reacted with checkmark (âœ…) emoji.
* These users are automatically added as attendees to the event.

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} or ask in the [Forum]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

Happy Hacking!

nodes.name: Reply Invite with EventId
nodes.notes: This slack node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Calendar Event Booking Agent

parameters.text:
=Your role is to create professional event calendar events based on user message.
Given the following user message, do the following 5 tasks. Note, Assume all dates are within the current year which is {{ $now.format("yyyy") }} unless stated otherwise.
1. Summarize the message and generate a title for the event. Make sure it's eye-catching to attract more attendees!
2. Determine and extract the start date and time for the event. Date must be in the format yyyy-MM-dd and time in the format of hh:mm:ss. If no start time is indicated, the start time is 9am. If you are unable to do so, just leave it blank.
3. Determine and extract the end date and time for the event. Date must be in the format yyyy-MM-dd and time in the format of hh:mm:ss. If you are unable to do so, just leave it blank.
4. Where the user message refers to a location or venue, use the SerpAPI tool to search for this location or venue on the web and retrieve the full address.
5. Additionally, if the location or venue has a website or relevant webpage, return the URL of the location or venue.
6. Try to identify the event type as one of "social meeting", "social gathering", "business meeting", "business gathering" or "unknown".

user message:
```{{ $json.invite.json.text }}```

nodes.notes: This agent node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Splitout Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Splitout Workflow. This workflow integrates 15 different services: filter, stickyNote, code, toolSerpApi, scheduleTrigger. It contains 44 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 44
- **Node Types**: 15
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **For Each User ID...**: splitOut
- **Get User**: slack
- **Search for Invite Requests**: slack
- **Get Existing Invite EventID**: code
- **Should Create Event?**: if
- **Create Event**: googleCalendar
- **Get Invite Reactions**: slack
- **Get Invite Replies**: slack
- **Extract Invite Reactions**: splitOut
- **Get Old EventId**: set
- ... and 34 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
